headline: Baked Ziti III
description: Layers of ziti pasta, beefy tomato sauce, sour cream and Italian cheeses get a final dash of flavor with a generous sprinkling of chopped fresh basil before baking.
name: Baked Ziti III

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain.
In a large skillet, brown beef over medium heat. Add onions; saute until tender. Drain off fat and add spaghetti sauce; simmer for about 15 minutes.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

In a lightly greased 2 quart baking dish, place about half of the pasta; top with a layer of provolone and mozzarella cheese slices. Spread on a layer of half the spaghetti sauce mixture and sour cream.
Cover with remaining pasta, cheese and sauce; sprinkle a layer of Parmesan cheese and fresh basil.
Bake in preheated oven for about 30 minutes or until cheese and sauce are bubbly; serve.

review.reviewBody: Winner! Have made this recipe so many times.....I first discovered it when a friend made it for Grandparent's day to serve to all of the visiting grandparents in the elementary school. I have since used it to feed guests at funeral luncheons, an anniversary party and countless meal deliveries to those in need of a meal. I was told to mix the sour cream into the pasta before layering, and I have never veered from that piece of advice. It is creamy and cheesy. My personal preference for sauce is Prego Traditional. Enjoy!
We thought it was delicious. I swapped out the ground beef for spicy Italian sausage and prepared it in 2 small pans so I could freeze one for later.
I added garlic & Italian seasoning and it was still pretty bland
Good enough to save and make again. Recipes rating will depend on what pre-made sauce you choose. So, dont pick the cheapest kind.
Kids loved it which is a win win for me. My family doesn’t like ricotta so the sour cream is a good alternative. Definitely need a bigger casserole dish though. 3 qt would be best.
Delicious! Followed recipe exactly. Kids loved it.
This is delicious. I added fresh garlic to the recipe and it turned out great!
Loved it! I added Italian seasoning to the sauce. I used fresh mozzarella and added sliced havarti. It was extra cheesy and my family loved it.

I love this recipe! I used the recommendations of other reviewers and tossed the ziti with ricotta cheese (& egg). I also used shredded Italian blend cheese with shredded mozzarella cheese as well as provolone cheese. My family loved it! ThNks for sharing this recipe

2nd time around with this. Unfortunately I had to sub Rigatoni this time, Ziti s is my favorite macaroni. Like before the few slices of cheese lookeds so pathetic, so I used 23 slices of cheese instead of the 12 designated in the recipe. Taking the advice of tossing the pasta in some of the sour cream is a great idea. A hit in my home.
I added bell peppers, asparagus, and diced tomatoes!

My family loved it. I took the advice if another reader and tossed the ziti in the sour cream before layering. I also used 1 pound of ground beef and 1 pound of hot Italian sausage for the meat and added minced garlic into the sauce. Little changes, it was wonderful! I'll definitely make this again.
sour cream doesn't add anything IMHO. needs salt. will not make again

I chose this recipe for my teenager to make...simple ingredients, foolproof, guaranteed to turn out. even if you accidentally used too much cheese 
if you like things spicier substitute Italian sausage or add more seasoning.
This is a really great recipe. The only thing I changed was I added one jar of sauce to the ground beef and onions and then one jar to the cooked ziti. Very tasty!
Very good recipe. Easy and tasty. There was no way it was going to fit in a 2 quart dish. Grab your 3 quart and you’re all set.
All 3 of us loved it, including my toddler! I took the notes about mixing the sour cream with the noodles and added oregano and garlic and will definitely be making it again!

This recipe was almost perfect! I tossed the pasta in the sour cream like others suggested. I was skeptical about using sour cream at all but it did not disappoint. only thing I would change next time would be more parmesan between the layers, or even tossed with the pasta as well. It just needed that little bit of extra taste.
I make this to fill up my wife after a long day of hard work and to have plenty of leftovers on hand. Followed recipe exactly, but tossed ziti with sour cream. Provolone cheese is a must.

Super yummy and easy. I did what others suggested and tossed the noodles in the sour cream. Also, it barely fit in a 3 quart pan. I also used ground pork instead of beef . I will definitely make this again.
We loved this! It made a lot so we shared it with our neighbors, who also loved it!
Loved it. Will definitely make again. I did add sour cream in the noodles.
I did make it as suggested and will find out if the family loves it or hated it tonight!

This was delicious and my family and friends loved it. I only used one jar of pasta sauce and it was enough for our tastes. I followed the advice of others and added the sour cream to the ziti. I will be making this again.
It was okay. We didn't finish the leftovers. I probably won't make it again.

Wow! This recipe is amazing. Minimal effort and maximum flavor.

I didn’t think much of it at first when I found the recipe. I was just looking for basic pasta dishes, because I don’t cook much Italian food. But this ended up being a delicious “poor man’s lasagna”. If I closed my eyes, I couldn’t much tell the difference, from a flavor perspective. The sour cream combined with the provolone cheese really does end up tasting like ricotta cheese.

The only thing I would say is if you are using a 2 quart dish, it will overflow. I used a 3 quart glass pan and it was full to the brim.

Enjoy!
I followed another review and mixed the sour cream with the ziti noodles. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this step as it bakes better (minimal cleanup) and tastes fantastic!!! Will definitely make again!!!
Great recipe and I made it with Italian sausage instead of beef.
Staple in my house, we just omit the sour cream since husband will not eat anything with that ingredient.
I have made this several times. I have added more sauce and mozzarella cheese (16 oz.). It's a favorite of my husband!

I give the flavor of this dish 5 stars but the recipe is written with way too much interpretation. It never tells you how to marry the sauce and sour cream and a few other things. With that being said, I used 1 1/2 cans of sauce to simmer and the other half I put a big scoop of sour cream in the remaining amount and mixed. I spread that over first layer. I put the rest of the sour cream and sauce in skillet with the onions and let that simmer. I doubled the meat and the cheese because we wanted meaty and cheesy and we got just that. The flavor that the sour cream brought to the dish was so good.
No changes, and yes, I definitely will make this again. It was a giant hit.
I made it exactly as written. It was delicious! I will happily add this one to my repertoire!
I substituted vegan soy crumbles for the meat and the nurses I made it for loved it! Take care of the nurses who take care of you!
Used the recipe as it was written we loved it!!’
Made exactly according to recipe. Excellent! My family loved it!
No changes, will definitely make again
Everyone raved about the dish! Have made it 3 times since then and never changed a thing. Great recipe.
I made it exactly as it said although the spaghetti sauce was in two 24 oz jars not 28.

I use half beef half hot Italian sausage. For the filling I use half ricotta and half sour cream. Never thought to use sour cream in such a dish but I will never make ziti, lasagna or similar dishes again without using it! I use my homemade spaghetti sauce if I have some on hand. thank you for such a wonderful recipe! oh and it makes a HUGE batch! Enough to fill a 9x13 and a smaller batch for the freezer.

We loved this! I took the advice of another reader and mixed the pasta with the meat sauce, laid 1/2 down, cover with provolone, spread sour cream, layer the other 1/2 pasta meat mixture, cover with mozzarella and topped with Parmesan. YUM!!!!

I mixed the sour cream with the noodles before layering. Kept the noodles moist. This tasted so yummy! I added extra cheese just by a little bit. My family loved it, and great leftovers for the next day!
It was delicious everybody loved it . Thanks allrecipes
This was fairly easy but tasted awesome!

I highly recommend this recipe but do have some comments. I found sauce in our grocery store only comes in 24 oz size so I bought 3 of them and used 2 1/3 to get to exactly the 56 ounces total the recipe calls for. That was probably a little too much, will stick to 2 jars next time. Typical of recipes in this app the total time required is understated some. And despite simmering the onions as directed (length of time) they ended up a bit crunchy. Lesson learned - taste them next time. Which is fine but will just lengthen the total time a little more. I also subbed in low fat versions of cheese and sour cream and it turned out just fine in terms of taste and texture.
This is simply wonderful! I added the sour cream in WITH the sauce mix before layering.

I used ground chicken, and penne rigate noodles as I couldn't find any ziti in my walmart. Due to the size difference (I think) it was nearly overflowing my largest casserole dish! I had it in a baking tray in case it dropped while cooking (it didn't).
It was absolutely delicious. Will make it again for sure.
Made twice already in 3 weeks since finding recipe. Only different thing I did was use ricotta cheese in place of sour cream, and mixed it throughout the noodles.

I made this as per the recipe with the tip to mix the sour cream with the warm pasta. It was a big hit for my group potluck lunch. I also used Italian flavored turkey sausage. The leftovers are also great warmed up the next day. This is definitely a family keeper recipe.

A KEEPER!
A delicious meal. I didnt use provolone cheese because I didnt have any. I used mozzarella and parmesan in the dish and on top. I also used whole wheat pasta. I didnt think I would like the whole wheat pasta in this dish because of the texture but took a chance anyway. I couldnt tell the difference so I'll keep this substitution. I used a 11×14 dish and both jars of spahaghetti sauce. I know many people said its too much but my family love cheese and I knew it would be on the drier side without extra sauce. It was prefect! So if you use the amount of cheese listed in this recipe, you will not need 2 jars but I used 6 oz shredded parmesan and nearly 4 cups shredded mozzarella Also, the suggestion to add the sour cream to the pasta first is genius- it makes the dish nice and creamy! I topped with dry basil- didnt have fresh. Even with the larger 11x14 dish on 350, it was still done in 30 minutes. Next time I will make sure I have provolone. I think it will be more delicious but even without it, it's a 5 star recipe.
I’ve made this many, many times now, and absolutely love it! One of my all time favorite recipes. Easy to make and so yummy!
My kids love this. I think it’s a little dry so I add about a half jar of extra sauce and use 16oz of sour cream. It’s easy though and the family asked for it regularly.

I haven't had baked ziti in ages. So I made this dish and only swapped the ground beef with ground turkey which is so much healthier and tastier. It came out so good and delicious. I would love to make it again and try the other ziti recipes out later this year.

I made it the original way several times and it was a bit hit! I then changed the recipe to add sweet Italian sausage and extra cheese. I usually double the recipe and put half in the freezer. It is unbelievable how well this freezes. This has become a favorite of our large family gatherings.

I substituted sweet Italian sausage for half of the ground beef, added 3 cloves of garlic, mixed the cooked ziti with 1 cup of the sour cream and used the remaining half cup of sour cream to spread between the layers of ziti. Thank you for the base recipe. Excellent dish. This is definitely a keeper.

This was so good! I made some tweaks based on other reviewers recommendations. I used mild Italian sausage rather than ground beef. I added a good amount of minced garlic and Italian seasoning to the sausage. I also mixed in the sour cream with the cooked noodles. This kept the noodles from drying out. I’ll be making this again!
I did decide to omit the sour cream and it turned out great.
I used ground turkey and only mozzarella cheese cuz I didn't have any provolone. Was delicious! I've made this dish many times, never disappoints. Just time consuming.
Delicious! Made this New Year’s Eve 2019-20. I added a large zucchini finely sliced with the onions
I added extra meat and sauce. It was excellent!!!
Great kid-friendly recipe but a little bland for me. I will use a spicy arrabiata sauce next time or add crushed red pepper
left the basil out, added portabella mushroom chopped finely, onion and bellpeppers... also for cheese, added some Pepper Jack for spice. turned out Amazing!!

I mostly stuck to the recipe and was very impressed - it turned out great. I did mix the sour cream with the pasta which others recommended. I also mixed together one jar of spaghetti sauce with one jar of marinara sauce. Definitely adding this dish to

Made my own sauce with italian sausage. I did mix the sour cream with the macaroni like someone else suggested. This was the best baked ziti I've ever had or made. My family loved it. Was a little worried about the sour cream, but it was great.
This was an absolute hit with my family. Husband loves it! Will definitely make this recipe again and again.

AMAZING!! I made this tonight and followed the tips other reviewers suggested, ie. used beef and salsiccia, mixed the sour cream in the noodles, seasoned the beef while browning, and sauced the first noodle layer. I also used shredded mozzarella and Italian blend then topped with parm. This is now a family favorite!
I included both lean ground beef and mild Italian sausages. It was a hit with the family!
Great recipe! Easy and Delicious! Didn't make any changes! Everyone loved it! Definitely making it often! Thanks!
It was very good. Made a very large quantity. I will make it again but cut the recipe in half. Half would serve four. Tasty leftover.
Didn’t make any changes to the recipe. I used my own tomato Sauce that I make from scratch. Otherwise it was delicious. My family loved it!
Great everything. Couldn’t find zitti so substituted another pasta. 8” casserole dish easily fed 6. Added a little Marsala to top things off.
Was tasty and easy.
It was delicious

I made one change which was mentioned by another member here, I mixed the sour cream into the drained ziti noodles. Cooked it uncovered the whole time at the recipe time and temp. My Wifey and the Teen both chowed down and LOVED IT! Ohhh Yeahhh... IT'S A KEEPER!
Loved this recipe. I made it and followed it to the tee. I can't wait to make this again. Thanks for sharing
Delicious! Didn’t change anything from the original recipe other than adding some oregano to the sauce

Was a very big winner. I substituted one half of the sour cream with one half Greek yogurt! Will last for two meals for sure. I also used link pork Italian sausage that I cut up in half inch slices and browned first (just like you would ground beef or ground Italian sausage).
The only change I made was to toss the cooked, drained ziti in a couple big dollops of sour cream to keep it moist. I gave this casserole to my family members and it got rave reviews!
Awesome! Tasty! Filling!
It was delicious! Everyone loved it - even my picky eater 3 year old granddaughter!!!
I used hot Italian sausage which gave it extra flavor. I made it for a party and the feedback was very positive.
This truly was the best baked ziti I have ever made .
Made no changes and ABSOLUTELY will make this again! Not sure if it was the sour cream that made this sooo delicious or just a GREAT RECIPE!
It was perfect! We will have this again!
no changes. delish. my husband licked hit plate!!
Made it for a Bunco Potluck. Was a huge success! Only thing I changed is I used Mild Italian Sausage.

I would use less sour creme next time.

Very tasty.
My family did not like the sour cream, will try with ricotta instead next time
Didn’t change anything and will probably make it again very tasty
I’ll definitely make it again! Everyone in the family loved it!
I didn't add the sour cream but did add ricotta..really simple and family loved it!

I made this exactly the way the recipe read. It was very tasty and had good form to it. I really liked the sour cream taste . I’ve always used ricotta cheese but I prefer the sour cream. It gave it a smoother consistency and a better flavor. Very good recipe!
The recipe calls for a 2 qt. baking dish but when assembled, there was way too much for a 2 qt. dish, so I used a 3 qt. Which was fine.
Delicious! I took the advice of the the person that commented and said to toss the pasta with the sour cream before layering. Huge hit with my family!

As suggested by other reviewers I added the sour cream to the pasta before assembling the dish. Used hot Italian sausage rather than ground beef since we had that on hand. It turned out very delicious. Terrific recipe - thanks!
Turned out well as written (used Italian Sausage). Next time will add some mushrooms
I used ground turkey instead.
I used homemade sauce and did half sour cream half ricotta to make up the cup and a half. Was delicious.
Delicious . Great taste added by using sour cream. Very smooth .. family enjoyed
